article.headline: Rider 84, Siena 78
article.story: TRENTON, N.J. (AP) -- Jason Thompson had 31 points, 16 rebounds and seven blocked shots to lead Rider to an 84-78 win over Siena on Saturday. Harris Mansell added 15 points for the Broncs (11-9, 5-5 in Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), while Terrence Mouton finished with 14 and Lamar Johnson scored 11. Kenny Hasbrouck had a game-high 36 points for the Saints (11-9, 6-4), while Edwin Ubiles added 12 points and Michael Haddix had 10 points and seven rebounds. The teams traded baskets for most of the game, which featured 16 lead changes and 11 ties. Rider, though, took command late and finished with a 13-2 run -- including eight points by Thompson -- to gain the victory. Mouton's 3-pointer with 2:50 left gave the Broncs the lead for good, and Thompson sealed the win by going 6-of-6 from the free throw line in the final 29 seconds. Siena tried to rally, but missed three 3-point attempts down the stretch and went just 2-of-8 shots from the field in the final three minutes.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
